title: Set (deity)
summary: Set (/sɛt/; Egyptological: Sutekh - swtẖ ~ stẖ[lower-alpha 1] or Greek: Seth /sɛθ/) is a god of deserts, storms, disorder, violence, and foreigners in ancient Egyptian religion.[4]: 269  In Ancient Greek, the god's name is given as Sēth (Σήθ). Set had a positive role where he accompanies Ra on his barque to repel Apep, the serpent of Chaos.[4]: 269  Set had a vital role as a reconciled combatant.[4]: 269  He was lord of the Red Land, where he was the balance to Horus' role as lord of the Black Land.[4]: 269
